herbs.text:
Ginger (Zingiber officinale):
- Primary uses: Nausea relief, digestive aid
- Properties: Anti-inflammatory, carminative
- Dosage: 1-4g daily, fresh or dried
- Contraindications: High doses may interfere with blood thinning medications

Peppermint (Mentha Ã— piperita):
- Primary uses: Digestive comfort, IBS symptoms
- Properties: Antispasmodic, carminative
- Dosage: 1-2 cups of tea daily
- Contraindications: Gastric reflux, hiatal hernia

Echinacea (Echinacea purpurea):
- Primary uses: Immune system support, cold/flu prevention
- Properties: Immunostimulant, anti-inflammatory
- Dosage: 300mg 3x daily
- Contraindications: Autoimmune conditions

Chamomile (Matricaria chamomilla):
- Primary uses: Sleep aid, anxiety relief
- Properties: Mild sedative, anti-inflammatory
- Dosage: 1-2 cups of tea before bedtime
- Contraindications: Allergies to asteraceae family
